title: Gim Bo-eun
text:
Gim Bo-eun (born 8 December 1997) is a South Korean <a href="handball">handball</a> player for Gyeong and the <a href="South%20Korea%20women%27s%20national%20handball%20team">South Korean national team</a>. She made her Olympic debut representing <a href="South%20Korea%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Olympics">South Korea at the 2020 Summer Olympics</a>.
Career.
She represented <a href="South%20Korea%20at%20the%202014%20Summer%20Youth%20Olympics">South Korea at the 2014 Summer Youth Olympics</a> and was part of the South Korean team which defeated Russia 32-31 in the final to claim the gold medal in the <a href="Handball%20at%20the%202014%20Summer%20Youth%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Girls%27%20tournament">girls handball tournament</a>. 
She was part of the national team which finished at thirteenth position at the <a href="2017%20World%20Women%27s%20Handball%20Championship">2017 World Women's Handball Championship</a>. She was also a member of the Korean team which won gold medal in the <a href="Handball%20at%20the%202018%20Asian%20Games%20%E2%80%93%20Women">women's team event</a> at the <a href="2018%20Asian%20Games">2018 Asian Games</a>.
She was included in the South Korean squad in the <a href="Handball%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20tournament">women's handball competition</a> for the <a href="2020%20Summer%20Olympics">2020 Summer Olympics</a>.
